Sentence composed of 2 variables to describe how many people are following a user. In source English, the first variable is the number of followers, and the second variable is 'Follower' or 'Followers'. Sentence composed of 2 variables to describe how many imports were performed from loading a NostrScript. In source English, the first variable is the number of imports, and the second variable is 'Import' or 'Imports'. Sentence composed of 2 variables to describe how many reposts. In source English, the first variable is the number of reposts, and the second variable is 'Repost' or 'Reposts'.
Alert message that informs a user was muted.
When a note or profile is not found when searching for it via its note id
Reacted by heading in local notification

trans-unit.id: %@. Creating an account doesn't require a phone number, email or name. Get started right away with zero friction.
trans-unit.source: %@. Creating an account doesn't require a phone number, email or name. Get started right away with zero friction.
trans-unit.target: %@. Creating an account doesn't require a phone number, email or name. Get started right away with zero friction.
trans-unit.note: Explanation of what is done to keep personally identifiable information private. There is a heading that precedes this explanation which is a variable to this string.

trans-unit.id: This is your secret account key. You need this to access your account. Don't share this with anyone! Save it in a password manager and keep it safe!
trans-unit.source: This is your secret account key. You need this to access your account. Don't share this with anyone! Save it in a password manager and keep it safe!
trans-unit.target: This is your secret account key. You need this to access your account. Don't share this with anyone! Save it in a password manager and keep it safe!
trans-unit.note: Label to describe that a private key is the user's secret account key and what they should do with it.
Navigation bar title for note thread.
Text indicating that this zap is the one with the highest amount of sats.
Toggle to translate direct messages.
Button to translate note from different language.
Button to indicate that the note has been translated from a different language.
Navigation title for translation settings. Section header for text and appearance settings
Section title for selecting the translation service.
Setting to truncate text in mention notifications
Setting to truncate text in timeline
Text field prompt asking user to type DELETE in all caps to confirm that they want to proceed with deleting their account.
Text box prompt to ask user to type their note.
Example URL to LibreTranslate server
Button to unfollow a user.
Button to unfollow a given hashtag.
Label to indicate that the user is in the process of unfollowing another user.
Toolbar label for the universal view where notes from all connected relay servers appear.
Button to unmute a profile.
Context menu option for unmuting a conversation.
Text indicating that the long-form note title is untitled.
Button to proceed with uploading.
Section header for user profile status settings.
Alert message that informs a user was muted.
Alert message to indicate the user has been muted
Label for Username section of user profile form.
Label to display relay software version. Section title for displaying the version number of the Damus app.
Button to switch to view users QR Code
Setting to only see 1 event per user (npub) in the search/universe

trans-unit.id:
WARNING:
THIS WILL SIGN AN EVENT THAT DELETES THIS ACCOUNT.
YOU WILL NO LONGER BE ABLE TO LOG INTO DAMUS USING THIS ACCOUNT KEY.
ARE YOU SURE YOU WANT TO CONTINUE?
trans-unit.source:
WARNING:
THIS WILL SIGN AN EVENT THAT DELETES THIS ACCOUNT.
YOU WILL NO LONGER BE ABLE TO LOG INTO DAMUS USING THIS ACCOUNT KEY.
ARE YOU SURE YOU WANT TO CONTINUE?

WARNING:
THIS WILL SIGN AN EVENT THAT DELETES THIS ACCOUNT.
YOU WILL NO LONGER BE ABLE TO LOG INTO DAMUS USING THIS ACCOUNT KEY.
ARE YOU SURE YOU WANT TO CONTINUE?
trans-unit.note: Alert for deleting the users account.
Text telling the user to wake up, where the argument is their display name.
Navigation title for Wallet view Sidebar menu label for Wallet view. Title for section in zap settings that controls the Lightning wallet selection.
Label for Website section of user profile form.
Welcome text shown on the first screen when user is not logged in.

trans-unit.id: Welcome to the social network %@ control.
trans-unit.source: Welcome to the social network %@ control.
trans-unit.target: Welcome to the social network %@ control.
trans-unit.note: Welcoming message to the reader. The variable is 'you', the reader.

trans-unit.id: Welcome to the social network you control
trans-unit.source: Welcome to the social network you control
trans-unit.target: Welcome to the social network you control
trans-unit.note: Welcome text
Text to welcome user.

trans-unit.id: What do you want to report?
trans-unit.source: What do you want to report?
trans-unit.target: What do you want to report?
trans-unit.note: Header text to prompt user what issue they want to report.
Heading text for section describing what is Nostr.
Title for a screen displaying suggestions of who to follow
Heading text for section describing why Nostr is needed.
Text of button that confirms to overwrite the existing mutelist.
Button to proceed with posting a note even though it looks like they might be posting a private key.
Text telling the user that they are dreaming.

trans-unit.id: You have no bookmarks yet, add them in the context menu
trans-unit.source: You have no bookmarks yet, add them in the context menu
trans-unit.target: You have no bookmarks yet, add them in the context menu
trans-unit.note: Text indicating that there are no bookmarks to be viewed
Label for Your Name section of user profile form.

trans-unit.id: Your report will be sent to the relays you are connected to
trans-unit.source: Your report will be sent to the relays you are connected to
trans-unit.target: Your report will be sent to the relays you are connected to
trans-unit.note: Footer text to inform user what will happen when the report is submitted.
Accessibility label for zap button Title of notification when a non-private zap is received.
Button to send a zap.
Setting to enable vibration on zap

trans-unit.id: Zap attempt from connected wallet failed.
trans-unit.source: Zap attempt from connected wallet failed.
trans-unit.target: Zap attempt from connected wallet failed.
trans-unit.note: Message to display when sending a zap from the user's connected wallet failed.

trans-unit.id: Zap attempt from connected wallet was canceled.
trans-unit.source: Zap attempt from connected wallet was canceled.
trans-unit.target: Zap attempt from connected wallet was canceled.
trans-unit.note: Message to display when a zap from the user's connected wallet was canceled.
Text to indicate that the buttons below it is for choosing the type of zap to send.
Text to indicate that the app is in the process of sending a zap.

Navigation bar title for the Zaps view. Navigation title for zap settings. Section header for zap settings Setting to enable Zap Local Notification Title for section in zap settings that controls general zap preferences.
Placeholder as an example of what the user could set so that the link is opened when the status is tapped.
Placeholder example text for profile picture URL.
Placeholder example text for website URL for user profile.
Placeholder example text for identifier used for Nostr addresses.
No search results.
Dropdown option for selecting no translation service.
String indicating that a given timestamp just occurred
Prompt for user to enter in an account key to login. This text shows the characters the key could start with if it was a private key.
Label indicating that a form input is optional.

trans-unit.source: Only '%@' will see that you zapped them
trans-unit.target: Only '%@' will see that you zapped them
trans-unit.note: Description of private zap type where the zap is sent privately and does not identify the user to the public.

Part of a larger sentence 'Replying to self' in US English. 'self' indicates that the user is replying to themself and no one else.
Sidebar menu label for Wallet view.
Placeholder example for relay server address.
You, in this context, is the person who controls their own social network. You is used in the context of a larger sentence that welcomes the reader to the social network that they control themself.
